summary:
Técnico em Segurança do Trabalho, com
curso de bombeiro profissional civil atualizado, Foco em Treinamento de brigada de incêndio, simulados, gestão dos equipamentos de PCI, DDS - diálogo de segurança, liberação de trabalho altura, espaço confinado e a quente. Desenvolvimento de tarefas tanto operacionais quanto administrativas. curso de atendimento pré hospitalar, condutor de veículo de urgência e emergência, ótima capacidade de aprendizado e facilidade de me adaptar a mudanças, sou proativo, motivado e flexível, quero contribuir para um ambiente otimista e produtivo, agregando conhecimento para a cultura de segurança da instituição.

currentPositions.description: Condutor Samu 192, Checklist, atendimento pré hospitalar, remoção, cumprimento da legislação de trânsito, suporte básico e avançado de vida, conservação, higienização e manutenção preventiva de máquinas, equipamentos e ambulância.

message.text: SSBC is now entering year 10 (final one!) and looking forward to sharing the story of the Programne - successes, challenges, positive impacts and outcomes -  a 2 day conference is currently in planning phase and are looking for an event manager to help us deliver this important event - please share with PR, event manager contacts - Ruby Bhattal Angie Dilley PhD Katie Peggs Craig Canham Jane Flewitt  Sandra Johal MCIM Chartered Marketer Agnes Agyepong
Pleased the evidence from Small Steps Big Changes alongside A Better Start colleagues is included in this important manifesto and call to action launched in Westminster

ingestedContentSummary.description: A Manifesto for Babies is published by the First 1001 Days Movement – a coalition of over 200 charities and professionals who believe that babies’ emotional wellbeing and development matters.
ingestedContentSummary.fullText: A Manifesto for Babies is published by the First 1001 Days Movement – a coalition of over 200 charities and professionals who believe that babies’ emotional wellbeing and development matters. Our members deliver a wide range of services that protect and support vulnerable babies and their families. These recommendations for UK policymakers are based on a survey of our membership. The Manifesto for Babies was developed by a Steering Group comprised of Future Men, the Institute of Health Visiting, NSPCC, the National Children’s Bureau, Home-Start UK, the Anna Freud Centre, AiMH-UK, the Association of Child Psychotherapists, SANDS, Blackpool Centre for Early Child Development, Best Beginnings, Approachable Parenting, Fatherhood Institute, OxPIP, the Parent-Infant Foundation and elected individual experts: Professor Eunice Lumsden, Bethany Boddy and Emma Carey. The recommendations represent the collective views of the First 1001 Days Movement, and not necessarily the individual policy positions of each and every member organisation. For further information please contact the Movement’s convenor Tamora Langley at [email protected]
ingestedContentSummary.title: First 1001 Days Manifesto for Babies

message.text:
Today the First 1001 Days Movement is in Westminster presenting their #ManifestoForBabies - recommendations for policymakers ahead of the next election - which we contributed to.

The Manifesto calls for:
👉 a strategy to support babies’ development
👉 investment in prevention
👉 tackling health inequalities
👉 developing workforce plan for children's social care & early years
👉 a review of tax and benefits system for parents and carers of under 2s
We’re delighted the needs of babies and infants are being heard in Parliament!

Read the Manifesto here 👇
https://lnkd.in/eu8Cwv4P
